## Definitions


---

<h2>Scientific Visualization</h2>

<p>
  <em>“The use of computers or techniques for comprehending data or to extract knowledge from the results of simulations, computations, or measurements”.</em>
  <br>
  <small>Examples: CT Scans, MRI, Inertial sensors.</small>
  <br>
  <span class="cite">[McCormick et al., 1987]</span>
</p>

</section>

---

<section>

<h2>Information Visualization</h2>

<p>
  <em>“Visualization applied to abstract quantities and relations in order to get insight in the data”.</em>
  <br>
  <small>Examples: matplotlib, seaborn, ggplot2</small>
  <br>
  <span class="cite">[Chi, 2000]</span>
</p>

</section>

---

<section>

<h2>Visual Analytics</h2>

<p>
  <em>“The science of analytical reasoning facilitated by interactive visual interfaces”.</em>
  <br>
  <small>Examples: Tableau, Plotly, Bokeh, Panel, etc.</small>
  <br>
  <span class="cite">[Thomas and Cook, 2005]</span>
</p>

</section>

---

### When is visualization useful?

<ol>
  <li>
    <strong>Too much data:</strong>
    <br>
    <small>
      <ul class="small-list">
        <li>do not have time to analyze it all (or read the analysis results)</li>
        <li>show an overview, discover which questions are relevant</li>
        <li>refine search either visually or analytically</li>
      </ul>
    </small>
  </li>

  <li>
    <strong>Qualitative / complex questions:</strong>
    <br>
    <small>
      <ul class="small-list">
        <li>cannot capture the question compactly/exactly in a query</li>
        <li>question/goal is inherently qualitative: understand what is going on</li>
        <li>show an overview, answer the question by seeing relevant patterns</li>
      </ul>
    </small>
  </li>

  <li>
    <strong>Communication:</strong>
    <br>
    <small>
      <ul class="small-list">
        <li>transfer results to different (non-technical) stakeholders</li>
        <li>learn about a new domain or problem</li>
      </ul>
    </small>
  </li>
</ol>


---

### Why is Visualization Useful?

::: columns
::: {.column style="font-size: 0.5em;"}

- (in)validate the fit of a given model with a dataset
- find the distribution of values over a given domain
:::
::: {.column style="font-size: 0.5em;"}
- find the correlation (or lack thereof) of several variables
- answer precise (quantitative) questions
:::
:::

### Why is Visualization?

::: columns
::: {.column style="font-size: 0.5em;"}

- find support for a new model in the data
- find which model best fits a dataset
:::

::: {.column style="font-size: 0.5em;"}
- find the phenomenon behind the data
- answer more vague (qualitative) questions
:::
